page.title: 06 THE TREAT--SHIREMOOR.
page.content: In July, in the field near the cross roads south of Backworth, the Shiremoor Treat is held every year.The Treat is a continuation of a miners'tradition started 78years ago when a Mr Niven and a few other men got together at the pit heap near the Blue Bell and decided to do something for the minerÂ£s kids i.e. Â£a treat'. Today the Treat is for all the local school children.Jazz Bands march from the villages to the Treat field and as they go the children follow.During the day the children take part in football day the children take part in races and football and netball matches.All the chidren who go to the treat are given a bag of sweets, a drink and and an ice-cream.A travelling fair completes the festivities. The tradition continues even though the pits have gone.
